short row notes from the designer cindy is a simple clean open-fronted cardigan pattern the sweater is knit in pieces and seamed at the end with the front garter stitch edging and collar picked up and worked at the end the bracelet-length sleeves have a cable motif worked up the center of the panel and the bottom hem hits at the high hip this pattern was designed to be both a simple cardigan while also being a quick knit for the more experienced knitter this cardigan was named after my mother who often wears simple cardigans while around the house and garden the cindy cardigan is the perfect layering piece for when you need just a bit of warmth * click here 6 to watch a tutorial on tips to make your handmade cardigans fit well * cardigan is worked in pieces and seamed after blocking * front garter stitch edging and collar is picked up and knit at the end of piece * because this cardigan has minimal shaping it is easy to change the length of the body and sleeves if you wish to have
